categories.Name: Beef
categories.Description: Beef is the culinary name for meat from cattle, particularly skeletal muscle.  Beef is a source of high-quality protein and essential nutrients.

categories.Name: Chicken
categories.Description: Chicken is a type of domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the red junglefowl.

categories.Name: Dessert
categories.Description: The term dessert can apply to many confections, such as biscuits, cakes, cookies, custards, gelatins, ice creams, pastries, pies, puddings, and sweet soups, and tarts.

categories.Name: Lamb
categories.Description: Lamb, hogget, and mutton are the meat of domestic sheep at different ages.

categories.Name: Miscellaneous
categories.Description: General foods that don't fit into another category

categories.Name: Pasta
categories.Description: Pasta is a staple food of traditional Italian cuisine.

categories.Name: Pork
categories.Description: Pork is the culinary name for meat from a domestic pig. It is the most commonly consumed meat worldwide.

categories.Name: Seafood
categories.Description: Seafood is any form of sea life regarded as food by humans.

categories.Name: Side
categories.Description: A side dish, sometimes referred to as a side order, side item, or simply a side, is a food item that accompanies the entrée or main course at a meal.

categories.Name: Starter
categories.Description: An entrée in modern French table service and that of much of the English-speaking world (apart from the United States and parts of Canada) is a dish served before the main course of a meal.

categories.Name: Vegan
categories.Description: Veganism is both the practice of abstaining from the use of animal products, particularly in diet, and an associated philosophy that rejects the commodity status of animals.

categories.Name: Vegetarian
categories.Description: Vegetarianism is the practice of abstaining from the consumption of meat (red meat, poultry, seafood, and the flesh of any other animal), and may also include abstention from by-products of animal slaughter.

categories.Name: Breakfast
categories.Description: Breakfast is the first meal of a day. The word in English refers to breaking the fasting period of the previous night.

categories.Name: Goat
categories.Description: The goat is a member of the animal family Bovidae and the subfamily Caprinae, meaning it is closely related to the sheep.
